description:
When trying to boot a VM with the VMwareVCDriver with the VlanManager configure, I get the exception below.  I do not see this when using other network managers or Quantum. 

2013-04-21 15:36:16    DEBUG [nova.openstack.common.lockutils] Got semaphore "compute_resources" for method "update_usage"...
2013-04-21 15:36:16    ERROR [nova.compute.manager] Error: ['Traceback (most recent call last):
', '  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 905, in _run_instance
  
  set_access_ip=set_access_ip)
', '  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 1165, in _spawn
    LOG.exception(_('Instance failed to spawn'), instance=instance)
',
 '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/contextlib.py", line 24, in __exit__
    self.gen.next()
', '  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 1161, in _spawn
    block_device_
info)
', '  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py", line 176, in spawn
    block_device_info)
', '  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py", line 195, in spawn
    vif_infos = _get_vif_infos()
', '  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py", line 185, in _get_vif_infos
    self._cluster)
', '  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/virt/vmwareapi/vif.py", line 39, in ensure_vlan_bridge
    vlan_num = vif['network'].get_meta('vlan')
', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/suds/sudsobject.py", line 154, in __getitem__
    return getattr(self, name)
', "AttributeError: obj instance has no attribute 'network'
"]
title: vmware + vlan manager raises exception

comments.content:
When trying to boot a VM with the VMwareVCDriver with the VlanManager configure, I get the exception below.  I do not see this when using other network managers or Quantum. 

2013-04-21 15:36:16    DEBUG [nova.openstack.common.lockutils] Got semaphore "compute_resources" for method "update_usage"...
2013-04-21 15:36:16    ERROR [nova.compute.manager] Error: ['Traceback (most recent call last):
', '  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 905, in _run_instance
  
  set_access_ip=set_access_ip)
', '  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 1165, in _spawn
    LOG.exception(_('Instance failed to spawn'), instance=instance)
',
 '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/contextlib.py", line 24, in __exit__
    self.gen.next()
', '  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/manager.py", line 1161, in _spawn
    block_device_
info)
', '  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py", line 176, in spawn
    block_device_info)
', '  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py", line 195, in spawn
    vif_infos = _get_vif_infos()
', '  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py", line 185, in _get_vif_infos
    self._cluster)
', '  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/virt/vmwareapi/vif.py", line 39, in ensure_vlan_bridge
    vlan_num = vif['network'].get_meta('vlan')
', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/suds/sudsobject.py", line 154, in __getitem__
    return getattr(self, name)
', "AttributeError: obj instance has no attribute 'network'
"]
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~danwent

comments.content:
The change required is so trivial that it was hard to spot at first.  In vmwareapi/vif.py: 

-def ensure_vlan_bridge(self, session, vif, cluster=None):
+def ensure_vlan_bridge(session, vif, cluster=None):

that is, ensure_vlan_bridge incorrectly included "self" when it was not part of an object.  

the real question here is why this was not covered by a unit test.  With shaking hands, I will now go run a coverage report.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~danwent

comments.content: I believe Shawn H. is working on this, Shawn, can you assign this bug to yourself?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~danwent
